column1: Mahlsdorf  is a locality (Ortsteil) within the Berlin borough (Bezirk) of Marzahn-Hellersdorf. Until 2001 it was part of the former borough of Hellersdorf.
The locality was mentioned for the first time in a document of 1345
column2: named as Malterstorp. Until 1920 it was a municipality of the former Niederbarnim district
column3: merged into Berlin with the "Greater Berlin Act".

column1: Mahlsdorf is located in the eastern suburb of Berlin
column2: at the borders with the Brandenburger district of Märkisch-Oderland. It is bounded by the municipality of Neuenhagen and Hoppegarten
column4: Waldesruh and Birkenstein. The Berliner bordering localities are Hellersdorf
column5: Kaulsdorf and Köpenick (in Treptow-Köpenick district). In the south of the quarter there are the lakes Elsensee and part of the Habermannsee

column2: crossed by the federal highways B1 and B5
column3: is served by the S-Bahn line S5
column4: at the rail station of Mahlsdorf. Birkenstein station
column5: situated in the homonymous hamlet of the town of Hoppegarten
column6: is close to the eastern suburb of the quarter.
